intro: Maba bequaertii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in tropical climates. Its leaves are typically broad and oval, while its stems are woody and often branched. Maba bequaertii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
